intro: Takulumena garayi, commonly known as the Yucatan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Takulumena garayi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
